page.title: 07Religion in the Cowtons
page.content: There are 3 Anglican churches in the area. The oldest is St Marys church at South Cowton. This is used by N & S Cowton residents in the summer. It is a popular venue for weddings being in an attractive country setting. During the winter worshippers use St Lukes church in the centre of North Cowton. The Parish church in East Cowton is All Saints, built at the beginning of this century to replace a church half way between N & E Cowton. This church now has a Sunday School. The Vicar for all three churches is the Rev. Philip Rushton. All Methodists in the Cowtons worship at North Cowton Chapel. It is part of Darlington Methodist Circuit and the Minister is Rev. John Mason. A Sunday school has been held for 15 years. The Bible Fellowship meets weekly, and a Crusader Club has just started.
